intro: Holothrix reckii, commonly known as the African horned lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant has strap-like, evergreen leaves that form a dense rosette near the ground. Holothrix reckii thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements make it a desirable ornamental plant.
